Sentencas: MnCo2O4 powder was prepared by a wet chemistry method using metal nitrates and glycine in an aqueous solution.
Titulo: Preparation and Properties of a MnCo2O4 for Ceramic Interconnect of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell via Glycine Nitrate Process

Sentencas: The phase stability, sintering behavior, thermal expansion and electrical conductivity were examined to characterize powder suitability as an interconnect material in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Preparation and Properties of a MnCo2O4 for Ceramic Interconnect of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell via Glycine Nitrate Process

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction indicated that the MnCo2O4 spinel synthesized by the glycine nitrate process was stable until 1100 degrees C
Titulo: Preparation and Properties of a MnCo2O4 for Ceramic Interconnect of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell via Glycine Nitrate Process

Sentencas: and it was possible to obtain a fully densified single phase spinel.
Titulo: Preparation and Properties of a MnCo2O4 for Ceramic Interconnect of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell via Glycine Nitrate Process

Sentencas: On the other hand, the MnCo2O4 synthesized by a solid state reaction decomposed into a cubic spinel and CoO after being sintered at 1100 degrees C.
Titulo: Preparation and Properties of a MnCo2O4 for Ceramic Interconnect of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell via Glycine Nitrate Process

Sentencas: This might be associated with the reduction of Co3+ in the octahedral site of the cubic spinel phase.
Titulo: Preparation and Properties of a MnCo2O4 for Ceramic Interconnect of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell via Glycine Nitrate Process

Sentencas: MnCo2O4 showed a thermal expansion coefficient comparable to that of other SOFCs components, as well as good electrical conductivity.
Titulo: Preparation and Properties of a MnCo2O4 for Ceramic Interconnect of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell via Glycine Nitrate Process

Sentencas: Therefore, MnCo2O4 is a potential candidate for the ceramic interconnects in SOFCs, provided the phase instability under reducing environments can be improved.
Titulo: Preparation and Properties of a MnCo2O4 for Ceramic Interconnect of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell via Glycine Nitrate Process
